analysis

Class StringAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • analysis.StringAnalysis

  • public class StringAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the logic of analyzing sequence strings. This class serves for MutationAnaysis by providing useful String Matching methods.
    Author:
    jannis blueml

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> AMINO_ACID_SHORTS
      A Map with all possible RNA and DNA codons with the matched AminoAcid in short form.

      • calculateLevenshteinMatrix

        public static int[][] calculateLevenshteinMatrix(java.lang.String horizontal,
                                                 java.lang.String vertical)
        Calculates the Levensthein Matrix of two Strings. The Matrix gives information about the differences of the two Strings and the best way to transform them into another. for more information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance
        Parameters:
        horizontal - The first String
        vertical - The second String
        Returns:

      • checkComplementAndReverse

        public static void checkComplementAndReverse(AnalysedSequence toAnalyse)
                                      throws CorruptedSequenceException
        This method checks if the complementary and/or the reverse gene has a better similarity with the mutated sequence the the original gene. If this so set reference gene of sequence to the best similarity.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyse - the sequence to check
        Throws:
        CorruptedSequenceException - if complementary cant be build
        See Also:
        CorruptedSequenceException

      • checkComplementAndReverse

        public static void checkComplementAndReverse(AnalysedSequence toAnalyse,
                                             Gene gene)
                                      throws CorruptedSequenceException
        This method is used when the gene is not the referenced gene in the AnalysedSequence Note: This method overrides the old referenced gene with the given gene
        Parameters:
        toAnalyse - the sequence to check
        gene - the gene you reference to.
        Throws:
        CorruptedSequenceException

      • checkSimilarity

        public static double checkSimilarity(Sequence first,
                                     Sequence second)
        Compares to sequences and returns their similarity without finding the exact differences.
        Parameters:
        first - The first sequence
        second - The second sequence
        Returns:
        Similarity measure

        public static double checkSimilarity(java.lang.String first,

        Parameters:

        second - The second String
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • findHISTag

        public static int findHISTag(AnalysedSequence toAnalyze)
        This method finds the position of the HIS-Tags in the gene.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyze - the sequence to analyse
        Returns:
        returns the startposition of the HIS-Tags. This is relative to the beginning of the sequence.

      • findRightGene

        public static Pair<Gene,java.lang.Double> findRightGene(AnalysedSequence toAnalyze)
        Finds the gene that fits best to a given sequence by comparing it to all given genes. Known genes can be found in the database.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyze - Sequence to be analyzed (i.e. for which the fitting gene is to find)
        Returns:
        The found gene.

      • findRightGene

        public static Gene findRightGene(AnalysedSequence toAnalyze,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Gene> listOfGenes)
        Finds the gene that fits best to a given sequence by comparing it to all given genes.
        Parameters:
        toAnalyze - The sequence, we compare with the list of genes
        listOfGenes - A list of all genes, we want to compare with the sequence
        Returns:
        the gene, that has the best similarity

        public static boolean findOffset(AnalysedSequence sequence)
